publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6032♦ Charlie Gordon: Celebrating the Scottish Football Museum—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Football Museum, Hampden Park, Glasgow, on achieving recognised status for its collection, awarded by Museum Galleries Scotland; further notes that Scotland was the first country in the world to establish a national football museum; considers that the Scottish Football Museum reflects many of the pioneering influences that Scotland has brought to the modern game of association football; wishes the Scottish museum a successful future, and would welcome admission to the Scottish Football Museum being free to maximise the number of visitors to the best football museum in the world. R

S3M-6032 Celebrating the Scottish Football Museum (lodged on 22 March 2010) Hugh O’Donnell*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Jackie Baillie*, Margaret Curran*, Cathie Craigie*, Brian Adam*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Butler*, Mary Mulligan*, Marlyn Glen*, James Kelly*, David Whitton*, Des McNulty*, Patricia Ferguson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mike Pringle*, Ken Macintosh*, Elaine Murray*, Trish Godman*
S3M-6032 Celebrating the Scottish Football Museum (lodged on 22 March 2010) Hugh Henry*, Gil Paterson*, John Park*, Bill Kidd*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Bill Aitken*
S3M-6032 Celebrating the Scottish Football Museum (lodged on 22 March 2010) Jack McConnell*, George Foulkes*

S3M-6032 Charlie Gordon: Celebrating the Scottish Football Museum—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Football Museum, Hampden Park, Glasgow, on achieving recognised status for its collection, awarded by Museum Galleries Scotland; further notes that Scotland was the first country in the world to establish a national football museum; considers that the Scottish Football Museum reflects many of the pioneering influences that Scotland has brought to the modern game of association football; wishes the Scottish museum a successful future, and would welcome admission to the Scottish Football Museum being free to maximise the number of visitors to the best football museum in the world. R Supported by: Hugh O’Donnell, Malcolm Chisholm, Jackie Baillie, Margaret Curran, Cathie Craigie, Brian Adam, Kenneth Gibson, Bill Butler, Mary Mulligan, Marlyn Glen, James Kelly, David Whitton, Des McNulty, Patricia Ferguson, Mr Frank McAveety, Mike Pringle, Ken Macintosh, Elaine Murray, Trish Godman, Hugh Henry, Gil Paterson, John Park, Bill Kidd, Marilyn Livingstone, Bill Aitken, Jack McConnell, George Foulkes
S3M-6032# Celebrating the Scottish Football Museum (lodged on 22 March 2010) Bob Doris*, Karen Gillon*, Aileen Campbell*
S3M-6032# Celebrating the Scottish Football Museum (lodged on 22 March 2010) Rhona Brankin*, Peter Peacock*

S3M-6032# Charlie Gordon: Celebrating the Scottish Football Museum—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Football Museum, Hampden Park, Glasgow, on achieving recognised status for its collection, awarded by Museum Galleries Scotland; further notes that Scotland was the first country in the world to establish a national football museum; considers that the Scottish Football Museum reflects many of the pioneering influences that Scotland has brought to the modern game of association football; wishes the Scottish museum a successful future, and would welcome admission to the Scottish Football Museum being free to maximise the number of visitors to the best football museum in the world. R Supported by: Hugh O’Donnell, Malcolm Chisholm, Jackie Baillie, Margaret Curran, Cathie Craigie, Brian Adam, Kenneth Gibson, Bill Butler, Mary Mulligan, Marlyn Glen, James Kelly, David Whitton, Des McNulty, Patricia Ferguson, Mr Frank McAveety, Mike Pringle, Ken Macintosh, Elaine Murray, Trish Godman, Hugh Henry, Gil Paterson, John Park, Bill Kidd, Marilyn Livingstone, Bill Aitken, Jack McConnell, George Foulkes, Bob Doris, Karen Gillon, Aileen Campbell, Rhona Brankin, Peter Peacock, David Stewart*
